intro: Leucospermum macowanii, commonly known as the Macowan’s star flower, is a striking South African shrub belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its dense clusters of bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer and autumn. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves that are grey-green in color, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
